method.name: emulation_dhcp_config
method.description: This procedure configures the DHCP emulation client. It creates, modifies, or resets an emulated Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) client or Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for the specified HLTAPI port or handle.

description.text: Specifies the handle of the port upon which emulation is configured. Mandatory for the mode -modify. Valid for -version ixtclhal, ixnetwork. When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology.
This option defines the action to be taken on the port specified by the port_handle argument. Valid for -version ixtclhal, ixnetwork.

choice.choiceText: Creates an DHCP session, requires the use of -port_handle.
Modifies an DHCP session, requires the use of -handle.
Stops the emulation locally without attempting to clear the bound address from the DHCP server.

description.text: Specifies the maximum time to wait in milliseconds for receipt of an offer or ack message after the sending of a corresponding discover or request message. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum number of release sessions opened at any time by the DHCPv6 network stack element. The default is 500. Valid for -version ixnetwork.

Specifies the maximum number of outstanding sessions (unacknowledged discover or request message) allowed to exist. In effect, this is a rate limiting mechanism that stops dhcp servers from being overwhelmed with reqests. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
This parameter specifies the port upon which emulation is configured. Mandatory for the modes -create and -reset. Valid for -version ixtclhal, ixnetwork.
The number of addresses to release in the first second after stop command is received. The default is 50. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
Specifies the desired request rate in sessions per second. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
Limits the number of additional transmissions of either a discover or request message when no acknowledgement is received. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
UDP port that the client listens on for DHCP responses. Valid for dhcpv4 client.

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the dhcp client protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the dhcp client protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the dhcp client protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Minimum session lifetime (in seconds). Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Maximum number of times each session is automatically restarted. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Maximum session lifetime(in seconds). Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Enable automatic session restart after stop at lifetime expiry. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Enable session lifetime. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Allow each session to always be automatically restarted Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
The UDP port to which the client addresses its server requests. The default value port number is 67. Valid for -version ixnetwork.

If true, the DHCPv6 client will send Request messages to any server that has the same IA information (addresses and options) as presented in the previous Advertisement message. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum rebind timeout value, in seconds. The default value is 600. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The initial rebind timeout, in seconds. The default value is 10. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The number of release attempts. The default value is 5. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The initial release timeout, in seconds. The default value is 1. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum renew request timeout value, in seconds. The default value is 600. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The initial renew timeout, in seconds. The default value is 10. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The number of release attempts. The default value is 5. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum request timeout value, in seconds. The default value is 30. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The initial request timeout value, in seconds. The default value is 1. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum solicit retry attempts. The default value is 3. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The maximum solicit timeout value, in seconds. The default value is 120. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The Initial solicit timeout, in seconds. The default value is 1. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
Initial information-request timeout value, in seconds. Valid for dhcpv6 client.
Max Information-request timeout value, in seconds. Valid for dhcpv6 client.
Info request attempts. Valid for dhcpv6 client.
The value by which the timeout will be multiplied each time the response timeout has been reached. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
The max value, in seconds, that the discover timeout can reach though Discover Timeout Factor.
If enabled, all the rate settings defined at the global level will be overridden by the rate settings defined on this port. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
If enabled, all the rate settings defined at the session level will be overridden by rate settings defined on this port. Valid for -version ixnetwork.
If enabled, the client does not send a DHCP release packet when the stop command is given. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
Indicate to renew the active DHCP sessions after link status goes down and up. Valid for both dhcpv4 and dhcpv6 client.
DHCP Client type: IPv4 or IPv6.
If enabled, DHCP clients ARP to find their Gateway MAC Addresses.
If enabled, DHCP clients NS to find their Gateway MAC Addresses.

returnValue.value: Port handle on which DHCP emulation was configured

notes.note: When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology.

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::emulation_dhcp_config
# This command can be used to modify an existing Dhcp Client Configuration
set dhcp_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_dhcp_config \ -handle $dhcp_client \ -mode modify \ -release_rate 65 \ -msg_timeout 5 \ -request_rate 7 \ -retry_count 2 \ -interval_stop 5 \ -interval_start 6 \ -min_lifetime 10 \ -max_restarts 20 \ -max_lifetime 30 \ -enable_restart 1 \ -enable_lifetime 0 \ -client_port 119 \ -skip_release_on_stop 1 \ -renew_on_link_up 1 \ ]
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {status 1}
# This command is to configure DHCP Global Paramaeters
set dhcpv4client_1_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_dhcp_config \ -retry_count 3 \ -handle /globals \ -server_port 67 \ -start_scale_mode port \ -mode create \ -skip_release_on_stop 0 \ -enable_restart 0 \ -msg_timeout 4 \ -ip_version 4 \ -stop_scale_mode port \ -interval_start 1000 \ -client_port 68 \ -msg_timeout_factor 2 \ -enable_lifetime 0 \ -override_global_setup_rate 1 \ -renew_on_link_up 0 \ -interval_stop 1000 \ -override_global_teardown_rate 1 \ ]
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {status 1}

# Command :- Emulation Dhcp Config # This command can be used to modify an existing Dhcp Client Configuration
${result} = Emulation Dhcp Config handle=$(dhcp_client) handle=$(dhcp_client) =$dhcp_client mode=modify ... release_rate=65 msg_timeout=5 request_rate=7 retry_count=2 interval_stop=5 interval_start=6 ... min_lifetime=10 max_restarts=20 max_lifetime=30 enable_restart=1 enable_lifetime=0 client_port=119 ... skip_release_on_stop=1 renew_on_link_up=1 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${dhcp_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} dhcp_status
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {status 1} # This command is to configure DHCP Global Paramaeters
${result} = Emulation Dhcp Config retry_count=3 handle=/globals server_port=67 ... start_scale_mode=port mode=create skip_release_on_stop=0 enable_restart=0 msg_timeout=4 ... ip_version=4 stop_scale_mode=port interval_start=1000 client_port=68 msg_timeout_factor=2 ... enable_lifetime=0 override_global_setup_rate=1 renew_on_link_up=0 interval_stop=1000 override_global_teardown_rate=1 ${status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} status Run Keyword If '${status}' != '1' FAIL "Error: Status is not SUCCESS" ELSE Log "Status is SUCCESS" ${dhcpv4client_1_status} = Get From Dictionary ${result} dhcpv4client_1_status
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {status 1}
